taskDescription:
A box has dimensions of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>15</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mn>10</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
  <mn>25</mn>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">15\,{\text{cm}} \times 10\,{\text{cm}} \times 25\,{\text{cm}}</annotation></semantics></math>. The box currently holds 1,750 cm<sup>3</sup> of black beans. How many cubic centimeters of black beans are needed to completely fill the box?
